reviewText: I can watch these DVDs over and over and over and laugh until I cry every time! Shame on Comedy Central for not keeping this show on the air!!!
Title: Chocolate News: The Complete Series

reviewText: From the 2008 Comedy Central archive, the 2-Disc Complete Series release of "The Chocolate News" will feature every episode of the short-lived David Alan Grier project.  Before you get too excited, though, the complete series was only 10 episodes at approximately 23 minutes each. The current list price of $39.95 before discounts and sales seems pretty steep for less than 4 hours worth of programming, so I'd certainly recommend keeping your eyes peeled for a reasonable sales price before investing. As a series, "The Chocolate News" is set up much like any other satiric news program.  It aims for the same type of audience that made Colbert and Stewart household names, but skews contemporary society through a decidedly ethnic perspective.  Grier serves as the show's creator and its fictional host, and the mock news program introduces several bizarre and unsettling stories within each episode.  Grier does not go for subtlety here, and it's this anything-can-happen vibe that distinguishes the presentation.  Loud, obnoxious, crude, and offensive are just a few of the compliments I can pay Grier who crosses the line of political correctness without apology.Frequent targets of "The Chocolate News" include hip hop culture, Obama, drugs, current events, black celebrities, and other things that create a racial division.  The show pokes fun at any number of extremely sensitive topics in an exceptionally confrontational way.  If the idea of this bothers you, this isn't going to be something you'll enjoy.  But the show also excels with parodies of contemporary pop culture phenomenon.  What, for example, could be more delightful than a spoof called America's Next Top Black Preacher?  How about a black Comic-Con?  A black KISS?  A rapper working for Nickelodeon?  African bottled spring water?  The fact that Beyonce is too white?  The episodes pack quite a lot of material in.  Not everything is a slam dunk, but if a story doesn't make you laugh--there's another one coming up shortly that will.  It is all just supremely ridiculous, but that's what makes it a pretty effective commentary about society's foibles.While David Alan Grier hosts the proceedings, he is ably assisted by a funny cast including Tangie Ambrose, Chris Tallman, Alphonso McAuley, and Jordan Peele among a multitude of guest actors that comprise these fictional news stories.  "The Chocolate News," ultimately, may not be for everyone.  I think those that hate it will absolutely loathe everything about it.  But I suspect many more will find much to laugh at in these 10 shows.  It's not a perfect program, by any means, but it is one that made me laugh with frequency.  It's a shame it didn't get to stretch its wings with a second season.  KGHarris, 5/12.
summary: An Ethno-Centric Look At Current Events (Circa 2008) Brought To You By David Alan Grier And Comedy Central
Title: Chocolate News: The Complete Series
